description: Team news for Thursday's Scottish Premiership matches.
title: Thursday's Scottish Premiership team news
title_page: Thursday's Scottish Premiership team news - BBC Sport
maintext:
Hearts hope to have midfielder Beni Baningime back following recent knee problems but Frankie Kent, Stephen Kingsley, Calem Nieuwenhof and Gerald Taylor remain out.
Hibernian midfielder Joe Newell and defender Warren O'Hora are trying to shake off knocks while forwards Mykola Kuharevich and Rudi Molotnikov could return following groin issues. Kieron Bowie and Marvin Ekpiteta are out.
Nicolas Kuhn is a doubt with a knee problem while Celtic team-mates Cameron Carter-Vickers and Auston Trusty have been recovering from illness and Alistair Johnston has had a hip problem. James Forrest is out until January with a foot injury.
Motherwell have defender Dan Casey available after a successful appeal against his red card in Friday's draw with Kilmarnock. Winger Sam Nicholson returns following illness but Ross Callachan, Paul McGinn, Zach Robinson, Steve Seddon, Callum Slattery and Jack Vale remain out.
